section1.title: 1. Introduction and Data Controller Identity
section1.content: In accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data (GDPR), we inform you of the following:
section1.app: This Privacy Policy governs the processing of personal data through the ChooseEat application.

section2.title: 2. Personal Data Processed
section2.intro: Through ChooseEat we may collect and process the following categories of personal data:
section2.registration: Registration data: username, email address, password (encrypted).
section2.preferences: Usage preferences: favorite cuisines, search filters, user settings.
section2.location: Location data: approximate location used to show nearby restaurants (if authorized by the user).
section2.technical: Technical data: IP address, device identifiers, browser type, operating system, access logs.
section2.usage: Usage-derived data: created sessions, votes or swipes on restaurants, basic activity history.
section2.sensitive: We do not collect special categories of personal data (sensitive data) within the meaning of Article 9 GDPR, unless you provide them voluntarily and explicitly.

section3.title: 3. Processing Purposes
section3.intro: Personal data will be processed for the following purposes:

service.title: 3.1. Service provision
service.content: Create voting sessions, allow users to join sessions, display restaurant information, manage user accounts and provide ChooseEat functionalities.

improvement.title: 3.2. Service improvement and internal analytics
improvement.content: Analyze application usage to improve user experience, optimize functionalities and develop new features.

security.title: 3.3. Security and abuse prevention
security.content: Protect the integrity and security of the application, prevent fraud, abuse or unauthorized use.

communications.title: 3.4. Service-related communications
communications.content: Send technical notifications, service updates or relevant information about ChooseEat usage.

section3.automated: No automated decisions are made that produce legal effects on the user or similarly significantly affect them.

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing (Art. 6 GDPR)
section4.intro: The legal basis for processing your personal data is:

contract.title: 4.1. Contract performance (Art. 6.1.b GDPR)
contract.content: Processing of data necessary for service provision and ChooseEat operation is based on the performance of the terms of use you accept when using the application.

consent.title: 4.2. Consent (Art. 6.1.a GDPR)
consent.content: For processing location data, optional marketing communications or non-necessary cookies, we rely on your express consent. You may withdraw your consent at any time.

legitimate.title: 4.3. Legitimate interest (Art. 6.1.f GDPR)
legitimate.content: Some processing, such as service security, fraud prevention and basic analytics, is based on our legitimate interest in providing a secure and quality service.

section5.title: 5. Retention Periods
section5.intro: Personal data will be retained for the following periods:
section5.account: Account data: while your user account remains active or until you request its deletion.
section5.sessions: Session and activity data: for the time necessary to fulfill the stated purposes or for a reasonable period (6 months from last activity).
section5.technical: Technical data and logs: for a limited period necessary to ensure service security and comply with legal obligations (maximum 12 months).
section5.anonymization: After these periods, data will be anonymized or securely deleted.

section6.title: 6. Recipients and Data Processors
section6.intro: Your personal data may be shared with:
section6.hosting: Hosting and technology service providers: for application hosting and technical infrastructure management.
section6.analytics: Analytics and monitoring tools: for statistical analysis of service usage (if applicable).
section6.contracts: Data processing agreements are signed with all service providers in accordance with Article 28 GDPR.
section6.google: Google Places API usage: ChooseEat uses the Google Places API to obtain restaurant information. No personally identifiable user information is shared with Google beyond what is strictly necessary for service provision (approximate location for geographic searches).
section6.noSale: We do not sell or transfer your personal data to third parties for commercial purposes.

section7.title: 7. International Transfers
section7.intro: Some of our service providers may be located outside the European Economic Area (EEA).
section7.guarantees: In those cases, we ensure that appropriate security measures are applied in accordance with GDPR, such as:
section7.clauses: Standard Contractual Clauses approved by the European Commission.
section7.frameworks: Recognized adequacy frameworks (e.g., European Commission adequacy decisions).
section7.info: For more information about the applied guarantees, you can contact us at [CONTACT_EMAIL].

section8.title: 8. User Rights
section8.intro: In accordance with GDPR, you have the right to:
section8.access: Right of access: obtain information about whether we are processing your personal data and, if so, access to it.
section8.rectification: Right of rectification: request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
section8.deletion: Right of erasure: request deletion of your data when no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected.
section8.limitation: Right of restriction: request restriction of processing under certain circumstances.
section8.opposition: Right to object: object to processing of your data based on legitimate interest.
section8.portability: Right to data portability: receive your data in a structured, commonly used format and transmit it to another controller.
section8.withdraw: Right to withdraw consent: at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
section8.exercise: To exercise your rights, you can contact [CONTACT_EMAIL], indicating "GDPR Rights Exercise" in the subject and providing a copy of your ID or equivalent document.
section8.complaint: You also have the right to file a complaint with the Spanish Data Protection Agency (www.aepd.es) if you consider that the processing of your personal data does not comply with current regulations.

section9.title: 9. Security Measures
section9.content: We have adopted appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, loss, destruction or alteration, including:
section9.access: Restricted access control to systems and databases.
section9.monitoring: Access monitoring and logging to detect suspicious activities.
section9.updates: Regular system updates and security patch application.
section9.note: However, no Internet transmission is completely secure. We recommend taking precautions to protect your personal data.

section10.title: 10. Minors
section10.content: ChooseEat is not intended for minors under 14 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from minors under that age. If you become aware that a minor has provided personal data without parental or guardian consent, please contact us at [CONTACT_EMAIL] to proceed with its deletion.

section11.title: 11. Privacy Policy Modifications
section11.content: We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time to adapt it to regulatory changes, service improvements or other justified reasons. Any modification will be published on this page and, in case of substantial changes, we will notify you through a notice in the application or by email. We recommend reviewing this policy periodically.

section1.title: 1. What are Cookies?
section1.content: Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet or mobile) when you visit a website or use an application. Cookies allow the website to recognize your device and remember information about your visit, such as your preferences or settings.
section1.similar: In addition to cookies, there are other similar technologies such as local storage (localStorage, sessionStorage) that perform analogous functions.

section2.title: 2. Types of Cookies Used
section2.intro: ChooseEat uses the following cookie categories:

technical.title: 2.1. Technical or necessary cookies
technical.content: Essential for the application to function. They allow you to navigate ChooseEat and use its basic functionalities (e.g., maintain logged-in session, remember selected language).

preferences.title: 2.2. Preference cookies
preferences.content: Allow remembering your user preferences, such as color theme (light/dark), language or custom settings.

analytics.title: 2.3. Analytics or statistics cookies
analytics.content: Help us understand how users interact with ChooseEat, which pages they visit, how long they stay, etc. This information is used aggregated and anonymously to improve the application.

advertising.title: 2.4. Advertising or third-party cookies
advertising.content: Currently, ChooseEat does not use advertising cookies. If we do so in the future, this policy will be updated and your consent will be requested.

section3.title: 3. Cookie Details
section3.intro: Below is detailed information about the cookies used:

section4.title: 4. Legal Basis and Consent
section4.technical: Technical or necessary cookies are used based on the controller's legitimate interest to ensure proper service operation (Art. 6.1.f GDPR).
section4.optional: Preference, analytics or advertising cookies (if any) are used only if you give your express consent through the cookie banner that appears when accessing ChooseEat.
section4.management: You can manage your cookie preferences at any time through the cookie settings panel available in the application.

section5.title: 5. How to Manage or Disable Cookies
section5.intro: You can configure your cookie preferences in the following ways:
section5.panel: From ChooseEat's cookie management panel: you can access it by clicking the "Manage Cookies" button available in the footer or application settings.
section5.browser: From your browser settings: most browsers allow managing cookies through their configuration. You can consult specific instructions in:
section5.chrome: Google Chrome: Settings > Privacy and security > Cookies and other site data
section5.firefox: Mozilla Firefox: Options > Privacy and security > Cookies and site data
section5.safari: Safari: Preferences > Privacy > Cookies and website data
section5.edge: Microsoft Edge: Settings > Privacy, search and services > Cookies
section5.warning: Please note that disabling certain technical cookies may affect proper ChooseEat operation.

section6.title: 6. Transfers to Third Countries
section6.content: Some third-party cookies (such as Google Analytics, if active) may involve data transfers to countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA). These transfers are made with appropriate guarantees in accordance with GDPR, such as Standard Contractual Clauses or recognized adequacy frameworks. For more information, consult the privacy policies of the respective providers.

section7.title: 7. Cookie Policy Updates
section7.content: We may update this Cookie Policy periodically to reflect changes in technologies used or applicable regulations. Any modification will be published on this page with the corresponding update date. We recommend reviewing this policy regularly.
